result.execSummary:
The defendant Benjamin W. Basswood was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Benjamin W. Basswood is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Benjamin W. Basswood was found guilty of Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Benjamin W. Basswood was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Jackson County Clerk of Circuit Court
Jackson County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Pay the costs of supervision.  DNA surcharge.   Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.

Defendant shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, or by any other means with his victims and co-defendant.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Use only 1 dispensary.  No contact with any drug dealers or illegal users, or their residences.  Not to be where illegal drugs are used or sold.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  

Participate in programming recommended in CHIPS case.

Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

Defendant to be subject to random urinalysis testing.

timeConds.notes: During jail term, counsel is to address programming for his addictions.  A treatment plan must be in place before he is released.  Credit for 18 days if defendant is revoked from probation.

supervisions.notes: Failure to pay any part of the court costs in full by the due date will result in 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Benjamin W. Basswood

ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody with Attorney Poss.  Parties have reviewed the PSI.  Restitution and victim impact statements do not apply, as those counts were dismissed outright.  Poss noted clarification regarding prior probation.  State recommended 2 year total sentence on count 3. 1 yr.  IC, 1 yr ES.  222 days credit.  9 months jail concurrent on count 4.  ES, per PSI.  AODA, no contact with drug users or dealers, CGIP,   The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Defendant is willing to enter into the family treatment court.  Court questions whether defendant is eligible for family treatment court.   Defense recommends: 3 years probation.  Defendant exercised his right to allocution.  Court ordered:  Count 4, 204 days, time served.  CC.  Count 3, sentence withheld 3 year probation.  Credit for 18 days served if revoked.  60 days jail, condition of probation.  During that 60 days, counsel to address programming for his addictions.  Treatment plan must be in place before he is released.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Participate in prorgramming recommended in CHIPS case.  No contact with MJ. LS,  MF.  No contact with any drug dealers or users, or their residences.  Not to be where illegal drugs are used or sold.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Only 1 dispensary.  CC & DNA sample and surcharge.  Pay costs of supervision.  Random UA's

Sentencing hearing at 08-10-2015 01:30 pm
I scanned this form a 2nd time because I couldn't get the sentencing date to print on it.  So I had to hand write it.
Sentencing hearing at 08-10-2005 01:30 pm

Defendant appeared in custody from Jackson County Jail with counsel SPD William Poss present.  ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  State has complied with victim notification.  Defendant pleads guilty to counts 3 & 4 in the Information.  Judge reviews charges/elements/plea questionnaire with defendant.  Finds the defendant freely, voluntarily, and intelligently enters his pleas and waives his rights.  Finding of guilty on Counts 3 & 4.  Counts 1 & 2 are dismissed.  PSI ordered with a due date of 7-31-15 and sentencing set for 8-10-15 at 1:30.
Plea hearing at 06-08-2015 01:30 pm
ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared through counsel, William Poss.  Plea hearing set for 6/8/15 at 1:30 pm

Status conference at 06-01-2015 03:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference at 05-27-2015 10:00 am.

ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody.  Attorney Poss appeared.  Reading of information waived, defendant stood mute.   Court entered NGP.   Attorney Poss stated they are waiting for the results of defendant's revocation hearing on another case.  PTC & STC set.
Arraignment at 05-06-2015 04:00 pm
#1 - photo
Exhibits 1 - 2

Defendant appeared in custody with counsel SPD William Poss.  ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Court orders witnesses sequestered.  State calls 1st witness, sworn, and testifies.  Defense stipulates to identification of defendant.  Court states the record will reflect ID of defendant.  Defense questions witness.  Re-direct of witness #1 by ADA Inlow.  Poss asks follow-up questions.  Witness #1 steps down.  Defense calls witness #2, sworn, testifies.  Defense questions witness.  Re-direct of witness by ADA Inlow.  No further questions by defense.  State calls witness #3, sworn, testifies.  Exhibit 1 marked - photos of injuries to M.J.; offered and received.  No objections.  Exhibit 2 marked - report of Det. Bowe - used to refresh memory.  Attorney Poss questions witness.  No further questions.  Witness excused.  No further witnesses.  Court finds probable cause exists and defendant is bound over for trial.  Arraignment set for May 6, 2015 at 4:00 p.m.
Subpoena and Certificate of Appearance served on Scott Bowe to appear at preliminary hearing on 4/28/15.
Subpoena and Certificate of Appearance served on Allen Mock to appear at preliminary hearing on 4/28/15.
Preliminary hearing at 04-28-2015 03:30 pm

ADA Inlow appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant appeared in person by video from the jail.  Attorney Poss appeared in court.  No agreement reached.  Attorney Poss requests the matter be set for preliminary hearing.  Approx. 45 min.

Pre-trial conference at 02-04-2015 10:00 am.
Status conference at 02-23-2015 03:00 pm.
Court questions defendant on waiver of time limits.  Defendant understands.  Court accepts waiver.
